alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 4:22AM EST until November 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Wintry mix expected. Total snow and sleet accumulation around 1 to 3 inches. Ice accumulation around a tenth up to a quarter inch. The highest snow and ice accumulations are most likely along and east of Keysers Ridge in Garrett County, and along/west of the Allegheny Front in western Allegany as well as western Grant and western Mineral Counties. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett and Extreme Western Allegany Counties. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Mineral Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to midnight tonight. A wintry mix will begin between 10 AM and 1 PM late this morning into early afternoon. Precipitation will change over to mainly snow during the mid to late afternoon hours, before mixing with freezing rain and ending tonight. Light snow is possible behind this system along and west of the Allegheny Front late tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will be reduced to under 1 mile at times in a wintry mix as well as fog.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
